form.instruction:
You need to make sure the adjectives in your lexicon will be mapped to the syntactic category Adj. Choose one of the following options, depending on your situation:
If you already have adjectives marked with the category Adj in your lexicon, nothing more needs to be done.
If adjectives are mixed in with another category in the lexicon, you either need to give them the category Adj in your morphological parser, or add the feature makeAdj to each appropriate entry in the lexicon so the category will be changed for the syntax.
If you have adjectives marked in your lexicon with a distinct category all their own, but it is different from Adj, enter that category below so PAWS can map your morphological category to Adj.
Adj
Run the file adjtest.txt through your morphological parser and then run the syntactic parser on the output. Check the log browser for the results and note any changes you need to make to the lexicon or to answers about the order of elements in the phrase structure rules. Make the changes as needed and rerun.
Please check off this section now in 'Contents' and then proceed to the Simple and Possessed Nominal Phrases section when you are ready.
